title: How to sue your employer for discrimination and wrongful termination — THE HEALTHY AMERICAN.org
cleaned_text:
Have you ever thought “I want to sue my employer!” — but you didn’t quite know how to go about it?

Join this live workshop to find out:
• None How much do wrongful termination lawsuits costs?
• None How long does it take?
• None What are my chances of winning?
• None How much money can you be awarded in damages from the jury?
• None How do you find the right attorney to represent you?

Get all these questions answered, and more!

Join this information-packed, (live-recorded) 85-minute workshop with Peggy Hall and California attorney Dan Watkins, who is representing clients in California who have had their religious exemptions denied, have been put on unpaid leave or have been terminated because of their religious beliefs.

Mr. Dan Watkins is a licensed attorney in CA and NV and is actively filing lawsuits against Kaiser, Los Angeles Department of Public Health, LAUSD and others. Mr. Watkins is a professing Christian and is operating from a strong faith foundation in all his dealings with clients and cases.

Peggy Hall, founder of THE HEALTHY AMERICAN.org is an educator and expert on non-discrimination laws. She advises attorneys, employers and employees on personal liberty, inalienable rights and the laws that protect them. With her husband Pastor David, Peggy has helped thousands save their jobs through invoking their legal, federal religious exemption to vaccines, masks and testing.

In this workshop, you will learn:

(3) How being put on unpaid leave constitutes an adverse employment action against the employee, giving rise to a lawsuit;

(4) An overview of the litigation (legal) process in terms of obligations and expectations; and

(5) How you can take the next steps in getting representation from Mr. Watkins and his associates.

THE HEALTHY AMERICAN is joining forces with Dan Watkins and his legal associates to bring powerful cases against the worst of the tyrants, including the California Department of Health, the Secretary of Health and Human Resources, and the Governor of California.

NOTE: Even if you don’t live in California or work for Kaiser, you will learn about how wrongful termination lawsuits work, what the costs are, how much time it takes, and what to look for to know if you have a strong case or not.

Your investment in the workshop not only gives you access to this important legal information and education, but it helps support the important work we do here at THE HEALTHY AMERICAN, and we thank you for being on board as we push back against this tidal wave of tyranny and restore our Constitutional Republic.

I look forward to seeing you in the workshop! ~ Peggy

Click here to enroll today before the discrimination gets worse!
